parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Coolant System Failure (IMS and Metzger Motor)
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the coolant system can cause sudden loss of coolant fluid, leading to engine overheating, seizure, and potential accidents due to loss of control or slippery road conditions.
symptoms: Coolant leakage from underneath the vehicle
and sudden loss of coolant fluid.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the IMS can cause the engine to stall, leading to loss of control and potential accidents.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Engine Block Leaks and Crankshaft Bearing Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the engine block and crankshaft bearing can cause engine destruction, leading to costly repairs and potential accidents.
The failure of the intermediate shaft can cause catastrophic engine failure, leading to a loss of power, oil leaks, and potentially leaving the driver stranded or causing an accident.
symptoms: Loud grinding noise from underneath the car
oil spewing out from the bottom of the engine
warning messages on the instrument cluster
and intermittent problems with the engine.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Unintended acceleration can cause loss of vehicle control, leading to accidents and potential injuries or fatalities. The failure of airbags to deploy in a crash can increase the risk of injury or fatality to occupants.
symptoms: often when the brakes are applied or cruise control is disengaged
and airbags fail to deploy in a crash.
